page.title: 13EBURNE SCHOOL WORK 4
page.content: The area under study consists of council house dwellings built in the late 1950's.Visual evidence shows that some of the property is in dis-repair.The population is transitionary and one third of all tenants are single parents(1981 census).{Wood End} is a comparitively new community.Its street names are taken from rural villages in Warwickshire.Prior to the council house programme the area was dominated by waste from two mines,the{Alexander} and the{Craven.}In some areas one can see evidence of the "black pad".People who remember the area 30 years ago told us of the building method used to construct the flats.Two tall pillars of steel were erected into which concrete was poured.This was allowed to set and the windows,walls,floors etc.,were built inside this shell.
